text_run.content: is a robust solution for transforming unstructured data such as documents, text pieces and images into a searchable vector
In many modern services and applications, there is a need to search by semantics. From searching for a chunk of text that matches the meaning of a

, to finding images that look similar to each other. A typical retrieval system that finishes such task are built with data preparation and embedding, a process of representing text or images as numerical vectors in a multi-dimensional space. It requires deep know-how and engineering speciality to build such systems. Zilliz Cloud Pipeline
empowers such use cases with a simple yet flexible interface.
in text documents, providing a critical building block of

such as image search, video frame search and multi-modal search.
unstructured data into searchable vector embeddings and

An Ingestion pipeline contains several functions, each describing a transformation of some input field, such as generating vector embeddings for auto-splitted chunks of the input document, or preserving some input value as additional information that can be retrieved during vector search.
One Ingestion pipeline maps to exactly one
on Zilliz Cloud. As part of creating the Ingestion
ipeline, the collection will be automatically created with the schema inferred from the functions.
Ingestion pipeline allows two types of functions.
vector embedding for each chunk. This function maps
as the scalar and vector fields of the auto-generated collection. The field names cannot be changed.
n Ingestion pipeline requires one and only one INDEX_DOC function.
user-defined input fields as additional scalar fields in the auto-generated collection for storing metadata. You can use PRESERVE functions to preserve the metadata of your documents.
A single PRESERVE function preserves one field, and up to five PRESERVE functions can be added to one Ingestion pipeline.

If you have documents and metadata such as author, publish date. You can use the Ingestion pipeline to easily build a knowledge base that supports vector similarity search. The text chunks from the documents, together with its vector embedding and associated metadata will be kept in vector database.
A Search pipeline allows one type of function.
text into vector embeddings and retrieves the top-K most relevant document chunks.
If you have a collection managed by an Ingestion pipeline, you can use Search pipeline to retrieve the top-K most relevant chunks and their associated information.
removes all chunks in a specified document from a collection.
This function deletes all document chunks with the specified
Example: Easily purge all data of a document

For a collection managed by Ingestion pipeline, deleting all entities (each with a single doc chunk) of a document is made easy with a Deletion pipeline. Simply create a Deletion pipeline and run it with a doc_name specified. All chunks of that doc will be purged.
